org.gbif.dwc

Class Archive

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.dwc.Archive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<StarRecord>

    public class Archive
extends Object
implements Iterable<StarRecord>
    Represents a Darwin Core Archive and its components (metadata, core, extensions).
    See Also:
    Darwin Core Text Guide

      • getConstituentMetadata

        public Map<String,File> getConstituentMetadata()
        Scans the archive for a semi-standard support of dataset constituent metadata. A dataset constituent is a sub-dataset which is referenced via dwc:datasetID in the data. The agreement first introduced by Catalogue of Life for their GSDs is to have a new folder "dataset" that keeps a metadata file for each constituent named just as the datasetID and suffixed with .xml.
        Returns:
        map of constituent datasetID to metadata file inside the archive

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws UnsupportedArchiveException
        Perform basic structural validation of the Darwin Core Archive: that the meta.xml exists, is valid XML, and necessary keys are defined.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedArchiveException

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws IOException
        Performs necessary preparation for iteration over StarRecords. If the Archive has extensions, all the data files must be sorted by the identifier column to allow iteration. This can take significant processing time.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • iterator

        public ClosableIterator<StarRecord> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<StarRecord>
        Returns:
        a complete iterator using star records with all extension records that replaces literal null values and HTML entities.

        Replaces common, literal NULL values with real nulls, e.g. "\N" or "NULL", and replaces HTML & XML entities in record values with the interpreted value.

        Archives with extensions, where the core id contains extravagant Unicode characters, may not be handled correctly. (This will not affect you, since you don't have ancient scripts, emoji or mathematical symbols in your core ids, but it is documented for completeness. Further detail in FileUtils.sort(File, File, String, int, String, Character, String, int).)

      • iterator

        public ClosableIterator<StarRecord> iterator(boolean replaceNulls,
                                             boolean replaceEntities)
        Parameters:
        replaceNulls - if true replaces common, literal NULL values with real nulls, e.g. "\N" or "NULL"
        replaceEntities - if true HTML & XML entities in record values will be replaced with the interpreted value.
        Returns:
        a complete iterator using star records with all extension records that may replace literal null values and HTML entities.

        Archives with extensions, where the core id contains extravagant Unicode characters, may not be handled correctly. (This will not affect you, since you don't have ancient scripts, emoji or mathematical symbols in your core ids, but it is documented for completeness. Further detail in FileUtils.sort(File, File, String, int, String, Character, String, int).)
